SEARCH
Package org.domain.classes

Class Distribution

java.lang.Object
org.domain.classes.Distribution
public class Distribution extends Object
The Distribution class represents a distribution system for arranging products. It maintains the distribution layout, handles modifications, and calculates metrics for evaluating the arrangement. This class provides methods to organize products using algorithms, modify the distribution, and manage the associated metadata such as name and timestamps.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Max Estrade Pey {max.estrade@estudiantat.upc.edu}

    • orderList

      public void orderList(ProductList list, AbstractAlgorithm algo, int xsize, int ysize, int limit)
      Arranges the product list using the specified algorithm and capacity.
      Parameters:
      list - The product list to be arranged.
      algo - The algorithm used for arranging products.
      xsize - Represents the number of columns of the distribution
      ysize - Represents the number of rows of the distribution
      limit - Serves to limit the depth we want to search for the solution.If limit is less than 0, the code ignores the limit

    • modifyDistribution

      public void modifyDistribution(int i, int j, int ii, int jj)
      Swaps two products in the distribution and updates the modified time.
      Parameters:
      i - The row index of the first product.
      j - The column index of the first product.
      ii - The row index of the second product.
      jj - The column index of the second product.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the distribution, including metadata and layout.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct(String name, int ii, int jj) throws DistributionException
      Adds a product from the product list to a specific position in the distribution.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the product to add.
      ii - The row index in the distribution.
      jj - The column index in the distribution.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - If the product is not in the list or if there alredy is a product in the position [ii,jj]

    • removeProduct

      public void removeProduct(int ii, int jj)
      Removes a product from a specific position in the distribution.
      Parameters:
      ii - The row index in the distribution.
      jj - The column index in the distribution.

      public void showList()
      Displays the list of products available for distribution.

    • getCoordProduct

      public Pair<Integer,Integer> getCoordProduct(String name)
      Retrieves the coordinates of a product in the distribution.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the product to locate.
      Returns:
      A pair of integers representing the row and column indices of the product.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - If the product is not found in the distribution.
